> So I'm thinking that the benchmark result is less important than the
> comprehension of how the encoding built its results.  CPPNs have the
> nice property that they are fairly straightforward.  You can look at
> each hidden node and look at the intermediate structure that it
> produces.  In e.g. a GRN-based system, on the other hand, it's
> significantly more opaque and difficult to explain, and therefore more
> difficult to bias.

Have you done this Ken? Was it helpful to understand what was going on?

Do you guys have a tool that makes this easy to do? I think it would be very
instructive to be able to look at the contribution of hidden nodes and
subgraphs of the CPPN network.

jeff
